name: Wall Drills
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back against the wall.
2. Make sure to keep your body aligned with the wall, without any inclination or rotation. Engage your core muscles by drawing in your belly button towards your spine.
3. Perform a series of small steps forward while maintaining the straight line from head to heels. Take about 20-30 inches (50-75 cm) back for each step.
4. Take about 15-20 seconds to complete one drill, depending on how fast or slow you go. You can walk in multiple directions (side-to-side, front-and-back).
5. Repeat the process for a total of 3-5 sets with 1-2 minutes of rest between drills.
short_summary: Wall Drills is a low-impact exercise used to improve cardiovascular endurance and increase agility while strengthening core muscles.
